title: Gossiping seems not to work in a private network
body:
#### System information

Geth version: 

```
geth version
Geth
Version: 1.3.5
Protocol Versions: [63 62 61]
Network Id: 1
Go Version: go1.5.1
OS: linux
GOPATH=
GOROOT=/usr/lib/go
```

OS & Version: Linux Ubuntu 14.04 LTS
#### Expected behaviour

Over time all machine in private network see each other.
#### Actual behaviour

Nodes only connect to manually added nodes (via admin.addPeer or bootnode command line option)
#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

I have a private network with following set up:
- I start two 'utility' nodes. 
- Manually connect them to each other (admin.addPeer()).
- After that I add public key of both of them to geth starting command on all other nodes (lets call them 'normal nodes') as parameters to the bootnode command line option.
- Start 'normal' nodes.

After that each 'normal' node see 'utility'/boot nodes, but not others 'normal' ones. I would expect that over time all nodes will find each others via gossiping with 'utility' nodes.

ntpd is started on each machine, so time synchronization should not be a problem.
Can you provide log output in a gist? Please start with `--vmodule=p2p/*=6` so messages about connectivity become visible.
@fjl That would need Geth 1.4. For the 1.3.x branch I think the correct parameter is `--vmodule=p2p=6`
Yes, you are right. For geth 1.3.x --vmodule matches basenames we need `--vmodule=server=6,udp=6,peer=6`.

I think it's worth to review my 'init' script (I only changed networkid).

```
#!/bin/bash

enode1="enode://6c5be77098117e36ad9a4778b3582c96a69ce7fdbd787820ed9f6d53e0fe602fd9ea19bf19f4639d695ecee58d029387eb0f18070090b5409bf20c100157afa1@10.0.1.4:30303"
enode2="enode://6384d4b51e3a466667a4f0c3c6af33844124da240886abe16473d0862973f0c9837ed09d71c8f7385719339a9058f4ef2918363bbc3ab05ae62fcb657e17906b@10.0.1.5:30303"

/usr/bin/geth --vmodule=server=6,udp=6,peer=6 --genesis /opt/etc/geth/lab-seed.json --bootnodes "${enode1} ${enode2}" --rpc --rpcaddr "0.0.0.0" --rpcport "8080" --rpccorsdomain "*" --datadir "/opt/chain" --port "30303" --ipcapi "admin,db,eth,debug,miner,net,shh,txpool,personal,web3" --rpcapi "db,eth,net,web3" --autodag --networkid 42 --metrics console 2>>/opt/log/geth.log
```

And that the output I got:
[log1.txt](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/files/229715/log1.txt)

I would expect that bootnodes option will ensure that a node first gets info from them.

Also is 'discover' require for gossiping? with '--nodiscover' seems that nothing is going on:

``````
I0421 10:35:01.927367    3056 database.go:71] Alloted 16MB cache to /opt/chain/chaindata
I0421 10:35:02.466414    3056 database.go:71] Alloted 16MB cache to /opt/chain/dapp

I0421 10:35:02.470853    3056 backend.go:326] Successfully wrote genesis block. New genesis hash = 611596e7979cd4e7ca1531260fa706093a5492ecbdf58f20a39545397e424d04
I0421 10:35:02.472426    3056 backend.go:362] Blockchain DB Version: 3
I0421 10:35:02.473142    3056 blockchain.go:214] Last header: #32028 [acc5cfe5…] TD=78179506151
I0421 10:35:02.473193    3056 blockchain.go:215] Last block: #32028 [acc5cfe5…] TD=78179506151
I0421 10:35:02.473212    3056 blockchain.go:216] Fast block: #32028 [acc5cfe5…] TD=78179506151

I0421 10:35:02.501374    3056 server.go:311] Starting Server

I0421 10:35:02.501664    3056 server.go:552] Listening on [::]:30303
I0421 10:35:02.501782    3056 backend.go:584] Automatic pregeneration of ethash DAG ON (ethash dir: /home/r3/.ethash)

I0421 10:35:02.502115    3056 ipc.go:112] IPC service started (/opt/chain/geth.ipc)```
``````

And that what I see after manually adding a node:

Important notice. I updated version 1.3.6 before producing logs.
On Ubuntu I see 1.3.6 and 1.5.0-SNAPSHOT I don't see a 1.4.x package. Does it exist?
getting the same "broke chain ancestry" on a private network, the only thing we did was change the network id.
I see normal connection now, so closing this issue.
